intro: Serruria congesta var. laciniata, commonly known as the lace-leaf serruria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its finely dissected, lobed leaves that give it a delicate, lace-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
